screen_desc: The screenshot shows the home screen of an Android smartphone. It features a pink gradient background with the date "Monday, Aug 22" displayed at the top. Below the date, there are two app icons: one for the Messages app and another for the Chrome browser. At the bottom, there is a Google search bar and a Google Assistant icon. The device is set to landscape orientation.
action_think: To open the 'Paramount+' app, I need to locate and tap on the app's icon. Since it's not visible in the current screenshot, I will need to swipe up from the bottom of the screen to access the app drawer.
action_plan: Swipe up from the bottom of the screen to access the app drawer
Locate and tap on the 'Paramount+' app
action_desc: Swipe up from the bottom of the screen
action_result: By scrolling up, you have reached the home screen and can now locate the Google Play Store app. This is necessary to install the user required app "Paramount+" if it's not already installed on your device.
